title: Self-Assembly: Shifting our View of Life
descriptions:
The proposed project, "Self-Assembly: Shifting our View of Life," seeks to revolutionize our understanding of life by exploring the concept of self-assembly as a fundamental process in biological systems. Traditional views of life emphasize the role of external energy inputs and genetic regulation, but self-assembly offers a new perspective on how complex patterns and structures can emerge spontaneously without external guidance. The AssemblingLife project aims to develop a novel theoretical framework within the philosophy of science that centers on self-assembly processes.

This interdisciplinary project will draw on fields such as nanoscience, chemistry, biology, material science, and philosophy of science to achieve its objectives. Key aims include redefining genetic causation by conceptualizing genes as 'nudgers' and creating a new theory of scientific explanation for self-assembly processes. The potential impacts of this research are significant, as it has the potential to shift the prevailing view of life in both scientific and philosophical circles. Additionally, the project will provide valuable conceptual tools to enhance research in the philosophy of science and empirical life sciences.

By shedding light on the role of self-assembly in the organization and functioning of living systems, the AssemblingLife project has the potential to reshape our understanding of life at its most fundamental level.
